versionTitle: Maimonides' Mishneh Torah, edited by Philip Birnbaum, New York, 1967 - corrected
title: Mishneh Torah, Testimony
text: If they were refuted after the execution of the person against whom they had testified, they are not put to death through an [a fortiori] inference. As it is written: "You shall do to him as he schemed to do" (Deuteronomy 19:19), but has not yet done. This interpretation is based on tradition. However, if the accused against whom they had testified was lashed, they are lashed. So too, if by the evidence submitted by them, money was handed over from the defendant to the plaintiff, it is returned to the defendant and they make restitution to him.
